intro: Aneilema oliganthum, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its attractive, velvety leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its flowers, which are usually purple or violet in color, bloom in clusters and are adapted for pollination by birds and insects. Aneilema oliganthum is widely cultivated as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and ease of care.
